snippet: The Man Asia Literary Prize, a cousin to the Man Booker Prize, will announce its winning novel on Thursday in Hong Kong. Seven titles from 2011 have been shortlisted - three from India, and one each from Pakistan, China, Japan and South Korea. The...
abstract: The Man Asia Literary Prize, a cousin to the Man Booker Prize, will announce its winning novel on Thursday in Hong Kong. Seven titles from 2011 have been shortlisted - three from India, and one each from Pakistan, China, Japan and South Korea. The winner receives $30,000. The judges are Chang-rae Lee, author of "The Surrendered"; Vikas Swarup, the Indian diplomat and writer whose novel, "Q&A," was made into the Oscar-winning "Slumdog Millionaire"; and Razia Iqbal, a BBC special correspondent.

headline.main: Man Asia Literary Prize to Be Awarded This Week
